item.title: MInecraft: Best Tech Mods You Need To Know
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Gregtech 6 is a standalone mod that extends gameplay with complex machines and utilities for a rewarding experience.
  • Stargate Journey offers dimension-hopping inspired by a popular franchise, with immersive features and community compatibility.
  • Immersive Aircraft mod enhances movement with planes and upgrades for efficient travel over vast terrains in Minecraft.

Minecraft has remained one of the most popular games of all time in no small part due to the endless possibilities available to players. Even in Vanilla, the options are endless, but once mods are introduced, it becomes a whole different game, and the sandbox environment creates a perfect blank canvas to explore anything an imagination could ask for.

The only tech available in the base game is very rudimentary, as redstone is the only real medium with which to experiment. So, modders in the community have taken matters into their own hands, with some extraordinary results. For beginners and seasoned veterans of modded Minecraft , here are the best tech mods to try out to start smashing through the industrial revolution, and beyond.

Updated September 2, 2024, by Amjad A. Asma: The list of the best Minecraft tech mods is ever-growing, as newer creations are added every day, and older offerings get steady updates. These mods can change the gameplay experience by a margin that is massive or small, so those who wish to take a break from vanilla mechanics do not have to leave the game altogether. Several of the Minecraft tech mods listed here still use redstone as a key component, but other choices of energy are available as well.

These tech mods change various aspects of Mojang's sandbox game. Players can pick and choose which one (or more) they want, since the options listed have been around for a long time, and their creators have had significant time to make them compatible with other mods. They also have dedicated communities, wikis, and in-game guides, ensuring that newcomers do not feel left out and that there's help available whenever needed. As such, players are almost guaranteed to have a gala time with these tech mods for Minecraft.

20 Gregtech 6

No. of Downloads: ~ 50K

  • Creator: GregoriusT
  • Download link: Gregtech 6

Unlike previous versions of the mod, Gregtech 6 doesn't require any others to be installed and is a completely standalone, overhaul mod. GregTech is built to extend the game by making everything more compatible and realistic. It also adds a lot of complex machines, as well as a great deal of utility to make everything flow as it should.

As a solo mod to play through, it doesn't get much better than Gregtech 6. While the learning curve can be a little steep if players are new to this kind of thing, the rewards are immense. It can also be used well as part of a mod pack and will gel well with a lot of other Minecraft tech mods.

19 Stargate Journey

No. of Downloads: 4.4M

  • Creator: Povstalec
  • Download link: Stargate Journey

Stargate Journey is a Minecaft tech mod that players who love dimension-hopping should try out. Inspired from the iconic franchise, it spawns a Stargate in key dimensions and allows fans to use these to travel. Creator Povstalec has added significant features to the mod that add immersion, one of which is that there are actually numeric addresses that players need to use when dialing to and from a Stargate. Besides this, they can also find a portal in each dimension, barring the End and the Nether, and there’s a fairly detailed method for how to find and access one.

Another feature that makes Stargate Journey one of the best technology mods for Minecraft is that it is compatible with other community creations. For example, if someone has Ad Astra installed, they will be able to find travel to the dimensions added by it as well. They can also use the Stellar View mod for a cinematic galactic experience when traveling. Moreover, fans can change many aspects of this Minecraft technology mod with data packs, which allows greater control of the overall experience.

18 Immersive Aircraft [Fabric/Forge]

No. of Downloads: 10.8M

  • Creator: Conczin
  • Download link: Immersive Aircraft

Immersive Aircraft is a brilliant tech mod that can be a boon for movement. Taking to the skies to travel is much quicker than navigating through the various biomes in Minecraft , where players can even fall to their death into a deep chasm. This mod adds a bunch of aircraft to the sandbox title that players can use to travel from one place to another, cutting right through massive oceans rather than having to go around them.

This Minecraft tech mod also comes with a bunch of new items and upgrades that players can add to their aircraft. These not only help customize appearances for a more personalized look but also add an aspect of tinkering that many fans appreciate.

17 Tempad

No. of Downloads: 14.5M

  • Creator: terrariumearth
  • Download link: Tempad

Tempad is one of those Minecraft tech mods that fans, especially of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, will want to try out. Inspired by the time-and-space traveling technology from the TVA, this mod allows fans to create a portal and instantly travel to a saved location. Creator terrariumearth has added a bunch of colors for the portals and the menu, but fans also have the classic orange hue available for their shenanigans.

What earns Tempad a place on this list of the best tech mods in Minecraft is the rather simple but effective teleportation it offers. If players wish to make the experience more immersive, they can even fiddle around with files and customize the gameplay. Currently, they can choose whether the portal takes XP or XP levels, if it takes a certain item to summon, the duration it remains open and the cooldown, etc. Tempad is rather lightweight and works well with other mods, but fans can also choose to turn off fancy rendering and make things easier on their system.

16 Alchemistry

No. of Downloads: 17.8M

  • Creator: Dark_Arcana
  • Download link: Alchemistry

​Alchemistry is a Minecraft tech mod that perhaps only very intense, science-loving fans will love. For starters, it adds a very good chunk of the Periodic Table to the game. By making use of the various blocks available, like fission reactor or fusion reactor, fans can break down elements into those with lower atomic numbers or combine them to go for those higher on the table. Essentially, they can break down anything they get their hands on and use the very components to craft something new. The struggle to transmute lead to gold is child’s play now.

Apart from the reactors, this Minecraft tech mod also offers blocks like evaporizer, dissolver, liquifier, and more. Fans can even use Alchemistry to try their hand at genetic modification. Like various other Minecraft mods, AlchemyLib, Chem Lib, JEI, and Patchouli are going to be integral in running Alchemistry properly, especially with the almost limitless possibilities that players have available to them.

15 Ad Astra

No. of Downloads: 20.2M

  • Creator: AlexNijjar
  • Download link: Ad Astra

Ad Astra is a great tech mod for Minecraft , but it’s more than that — it’s also a space mod. Players who wish to try out something different for their worlds should take a look at it. The featured changes it brings about are significant, especially the presence of celestial bodies like the Moon, Mars, Venus, and others. It could be considered one of the best sci-fi mods for Minecraft as well. There are also theme-appropriate vehicles, like different rockets to cover space and rovers to scout the planets’ surface and hunt for resources.

To make the experience immersive, the creators have added technology that players will need to implement for realism. This includes various machines and generators, networks for pumping fuel, water, and oxygen, crafting benches, and more. This Minecraft tech mod also brings in over 250 new types of blocks. For players who may find everything overwhelming at first, a detailed in-game guide book is also available.

14 Translocators 1.8.+

No. of Downloads: 43M

  • Image: ForgeOne
  • Creator: covers1624
  • Download link: Translocators 1.8+

Translocators 1.8+ can be of immense help to anyone’s storage system, especially those who wish to design mega builds in Minecraft . What this Minecraft tech mod does is that it allows for transfer of items, whether solid or liquid, between multiple chests and containers provided they are just a block apart from each other. This can be a bit of a limitation when trying to integrate a storage system into a set plan, yes, but the automation benefits far outweigh this.

There’s more to this particular Minecraft technology mod than may seem apparent at first glance. For starters, players can even use items to influence the containers’ working mechanisms. They can use materials like iron and diamond ingots to add filters, essentially allowing the transfer of accepted items and rejecting the rest. They can even configure the rate at which the items are shared. Overall, this Minecraft technology mod’s various features can help players automate a good chunk of their storage system.

13 Industrial Craft 2

No. of Downloads: 44.1M

  • Creator: sfPlayer1
  • Download link: Industrial Craft 2

Industrial Craft 2 is perhaps best known for the jetpacks and powerful combat armor it adds to Minecraft , but it has a lot more to offer. Starting from the early game, it adds tons of machines to help process and make the most out of resources and bring any world surging into the industrial revolution.

What makes this Minecraft tech mod so powerful, however, is the extensive list of add-ons that expand on the content available. Advanced Solar Panels, for example, can fully automate power generation. The only downside is its use of EU as a power unit, but this can be converted with additional mods.

12 Security Craft

No. of Downloads: 49.5M

  • Creator: Geforce132
  • Download link: Security Craft

One of the main grievances that Mineraft players encounter are others who want to ruin precious builds and cause random chaos. Crafty players do use vanilla to when trying to combat such griefers, but many are aware of the “tricks” to be cautious of. This is where Security Craft comes into play. It offers an exhaustive list of tools and modifications that players can use to safeguard their structures and maintain tighter control over attacks.

For starters, Security Craft offers explosive mines that can be disguised as harmless blocks, sentries that attack hostiles, a Block Change Detector that scans and logs players who make changes in a certain radius, and much, much more. Essentially, Security Craft not only ensures fair play but also helps players devise and implement shrewd methods with which to protect their homes and other projects.

11 Extreme Reactors

No. of Downloads: 65.9M

  • Creator: ZeroNoRyouki
  • Download link: Extreme Reactors

Extreme Reactors might be the most fun way to produce power in Minecraft, and it feels delightfully over the top. The mod is centered around building nuclear reactors to produce power and requires a lot of resources, but it is surprisingly accessible in the early game. It will require a fair bit of space and time investment, but the rewards are well worth it.

The beauty is that it is compatible with a ton of other tech mods, and with a few adapters, almost all of them. And yet, it is much less draining on resources than a lot of other endgame power sources from other mods. Best used as part of a mod pack, Extreme Reactors is a tech mod for Minecraft that is well-worth considering for a new world.

10 Mob Grinding Utils

No. of Downloads: 76.7M

  • Creator: vadis365
  • Download link: Mob Grinding Utils

Players look for the best Minecraft tech mods to revolutionize the way the game’s systems work, and Mob Grinding Utils is one that shouldn’t be skipped. Thanks to its significant changes in how players approach mob farms, the experience is completely refreshed. With the way mob farm mechanics for XP and drops work in vanilla, there isn't much room for creativity. That is where this Minecraft tech mod shines.

One of the key ways that Mob Grinding Utils helps players is by adding Entity Conveyors and Mob Fans. Through these, they can move creatures, villagers, or whoever they want and have a full-functioning factory. With Mob Mashers and Absorption Hoppers, the entire process of movement and killing and collection becomes automated. Players even get the option to store their XP for later use or carry it around in a portable fashion.

9 Ender IO

No. of Downloads: 87.3M

  • Creator: crazypants_mc_the_second
  • Download link: Ender IO

Ender IO is a complex tech mod for Minecraft , but the learning curve pays off if players are willing to put in some time. The mod will be a lot more accessible in the late game, as a lot of the resources required will be much easier to acquire in the End, but it can streamline a lot of processes and make lives a lot easier from there on out.

Ender IO is a great mod for automation, and the obelisks it adds can be used to store a large variety of resources that otherwise could not be, such as XP. Powered spawners are perhaps the most exciting addition, as just one of the ways the mod makes farming resources much easier.

8 Create

No. of Downloads: 89.9M

  • Creator: simibubi
  • Download link: Create

Create is one of the most popular and astonishingly thorough tech mods currently available for Minecraft . The additions that it brings are impossible to cover in brief, but what can be said is that it pushes the sandbox title's freedom of creativity to its limits. Players can create anything they can think of, whether it's a small machine for something as simple as a conveyor belt or something as extravagant as an entire system in place just to make cakes.

To put it simply, Create is a Minecraft tech mod that allows fans to start an industrial revolution that can put the first one to shame. There is a chunk of new items, gameplay mechanics, guides, and so much more on offer that players can build complex machinery and factories with imagination being the only thing holding them back.

7 Building Gadgets

No. of Downloads: 93.8M

  • Creator: Direwolf20
  • Download link: Building Gadgets

Building Gadgets is a great mod for players of all levels, whether they’re a newcomer or are well-versed in building structures of epic scales. It offers many features that help in constructing builds, whether it's creating walls or grids, copying one particular architectural aspect, or even clearing out a great area to lay the foundation for a new project. All of this becomes available and easily manageable by the gadgets in this Minecraft tech mod.

Anything new, even as simple as Minecraft mods that add new bosses, presents a learning curve that can be off-putting to some players. Here, however, the creator has added a book, "Gadgets for Derps," which talks about the various tools that this mod adds. Thanks to the in-game guide, players can understand the use-case of the various gadgets available, learn about keybinds and how to change them, and get started on their builds as soon as possible. The mod also has an Applied Energistics system, so players can use this wireless network as a sort of inventory even if they do not have the necessary items on hand.

6 Thermal Dynamics

No. of Downloads: 96.3M

  • Creator: TeamCoFH
  • Download link: Thermal Dynamics

Thermal Dynamics is designed to work alongside other mods in the Thermal series, and it focuses on transferring and storing resources. However, as the base power source is Redstone Flux, one of the most popular power sources in Minecraft mods, it can also work fantastically alongside other mods, as most can be adapted to use or convert RF.

This mod focuses on quality-of-life upgrades and fills a lot of gaps left by others in the ease of transporting resources across any distance. It's easily accessible in the early game and transfers very well into the late.

5 Refined Storage

No. of Downloads: 103.3M

  • Creator: raoulvdberge
  • Download link: Refined Storage

Refined Storage is an excellent mod to use as a standalone alongside Vanilla Minecraft. It does exactly what the name would suggest. Rather than having to rely on Ender Chests and Shulkers, the mod allows players to store all items on drives, craft grids, and controllers to access and sort them with ease.

This early- to mid-game mod allows players to access a huge library of items from anywhere in the world, and it is much more accessible in terms of resources and complexity than many others out there. Not having to go to the End to get access to good storage systems takes a huge burden off as players progress through a world.

4 Mekanism

No. of Downloads: 110.6M

  • Creator: bradyaidanc
  • Download link: Mekanism

Mekanism provides a huge upgrade to mining and crafting. It allows players to refine resources more efficiently and do far more with them. It functions as a standalone mod, taking players way beyond the late game, as all machines included are upgradeable as the world progresses.

Some highlights as players reach the mid and late game are fully functional jetpacks, a fusion reactor, and a digital miner that can filter out all the chaff from resource collection. Mekanism will change the way anyone plays Minecraft for the better, and it is one of the most detailed mods out there.

3 Thermal Expansion

No. of Downloads: 126M

  • Creator: TeamCoFH
  • Download link: Thermal Expansion

The Thermal series is one of the best-known in the modded Minecraft community, and Thermal Expansion is the highlight, as well as being the original. With a ton of machines added for everything from resource processing to power storage, it works perfectly in conjunction with others or as a standalone.

Thermal Expansion is one of the more easily accessible mods, but this doesn't mean that the late game is any less impressive. From humble beginnings, this mod can transform any world into a Tier 1 civilization.

2 Applied Energistics 2

No. of Downloads: 150.3M

  • Creator: thetechnici4n
  • Download link: Applied Energistics 2

Another very well-known mod among the community is Applied Energistics 2, which is arguably the best storage and sorting overhaul available in the game. It adds the ME system, which is one of the simpler computing systems added in a mod. It offers a very intuitive way to sort, craft, and store any items a player could need.

AE2 is a great way to get into the mods advanced tech mods in Minecraft , and it works brilliantly in mod packs, as the hundreds of potential items added can remain at a player's fingertips without having to scour through chests.

1 Tinker's Construct

No. of Downloads: 159.4M

  • Creator: mDiyo
  • Download link: Tinker's Construct

Yes, searching for clay to get started is annoying, but few players can deny that Tinker's Construct is one of the best early-game mods out there, and it's one of the most rewarding to get started with in any new Minecraft world. Tinker's doesn't add much technology to the game, instead overhauling the making of tools and refinement of materials with the Smeltery.

The beauty is its compatibility with most other mods out there that add new metals, making it the perfect way to efficiently gather and refine resources used to build machines added by others. It's one of the oldest and most popular mods in Minecraft for a very good reason.

item.title: 8 Open-World Games with the Best Landmarks
item.description:
Open-world games are all about exploration and seeing all its setting has to offer. Whilst mainly about the violence that can be caused, open-world games include some unique set pieces here and there, the joy in chaos would quickly run out, and some set pieces are more picturesque than others.

The beauty of Hong Kong in Sleeping Dogs contrasts with the banality of Steelport in Saints Row the Third . The jungles of Far Cry 3 offer more than the deserts of Metal Gear Solid 5. Assassin's Creed brings history to life, while Crackdown focuses on the near future. Each offers something different to the table. But some are more stunning than others, and these open-world games offer the best landmarks in the genre.

8 inFamous 2

The Colorful New Orleans-Inspired New Marais

InFamous was fun, though it came out when most games’ settings and graphics were as gritty as their tone. Empire City was beige, grimy, and didn’t get any color until the player maxed out their Good or Bad Karma, turning the sky blue or red respectively. InFamous 2 stepped things up by taking the electric-power protagonist Cole McGrath to a New Orleans-inspired city called New Marais.

It was much more colorful and varied in its locations, with bayous, rideable tram lines, tricolor banners, balconies, and grand churches players could climb all over. The waterlogged, hurricane-ravaged homes even offered a challenge to the water-prone hero. The only downside is the final industrial area, which was a dull note to go out on.

7 Saints Row 2

Despite Being Dangerous to Live In, Stilwater Offers Beautiful Locations

Stilwater first appeared in Saints Row 1 , though it was arguably as improved in Saints Row 2 as the gameplay and creative options. Its different districts are so recognizable that, after a while, players might not even need the mini-map to tell them where they are. They’ll recognize the locations from their distinct features, like Chinatown's ornate gates and architecture, and their positions relative to each other.

For example, from Chinatown, they’ll know the preppy university with its sarcastic cheerleaders is just a short drive northwest. Then one drive on the highway north from there will take them to the grungy trailer park, which is just east of the suburbs where Johnny Gat’s girlfriend Aisha lives. It’s a town rich in variety that the more generic Steelport from Saints Row the Third and Saints Row 4 couldn’t top.

6 Grand Theft Auto: Vice City

Bringing the Decadence of 1980s Miami to the PS2

It’s hard to pick out an individual Grand Theft Auto game for this list. GTA 4 stepped up on GTA 3 in replicating and mocking New York City. GTA5 ’s Los Santos has entertained players for over a decade with a wide variety of things to do and see. Though some still prefer its incarnation in GTA: San Andreas , which had more towns and landscape to explore.

However, the series has yet to return to the Miami-esque splendor of Grand Theft Auto: Vice City . Sure, it’s making its return in GTA 6 , but that’s a while away. Even then, it’ll be set in the modern day compared to GTA: Vice City ’s 80s setting. It sounds like a minor difference, but cruising past the beaches and palm trees with classic music on the radio gave GTA: Vice City a unique vibe.

5 Yakuza 2/Kiwami 2

Memorable Japanese Cities That Feel as Real as Their Counterparts

If picking out a single GTA game for this was hard, it’s harder still for the Yakuza/Like a Dragon series. They’ve got a lot of standout locations, though some offer more to do than others. The most common locations in the series are the original home base, Kamurochō in Tokyo, and Sōtenbori in Osaka, which debuted all the way back in Yakuza 2 .

Both cities resemble their real-life counterparts, Kabukichō and Dōtonbori respectively, from the former’s plaza of cinemas to the latter’s Kani Doraku crab restaurant. The remake, Yakuza Kiwami 2 , offers more to do and explore. But the original gets props for including Shinseicho, based on Osaka’s infamous Shinsekai district. It's famous for its Tsutenkaku Tower, though neither it nor Shinseicho has reappeared in the series since Yakuza 2 .

4 Marvel’s Spider-Man 2

Immersive New York City Landmarks, With a Marvel Twist

Plenty of games have used proxy cities based on New York City, and some have even used the real deal. Marvel’s Spider-Man games aren’t even the first ones to replicate the Big Apple. Those games just encourage players to check out all the classic landmarks (and a few Marvel-exclusive ones like Avengers Towers) by snapping photos of them for a little XP and a remark from Spidey.

Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 skips these Photo Ops for snapping people, yet it adds more landmarks than before thanks to its expanded reach beyond Manhattan. Maimonides Park, the Coney Island Boardwalk, and Brooklyn’s Brownstones join Madison Square Garden, Central Park, and the Guggenheim Museum as reasons to see NYC without needing an air ticket.

3 Red Dead Redemption 2

Explore an Expansive Frontier for Treasure and Natural Beauty

Games don’t need urban sprawls to catch people’s eyes, as Red Dead Redemption 2 is stunning without big cities. The wilderness of the Wild West provides some stunning views of the lakes, rivers, and mountains that few games could match. However, it still offers some enigmatic sights among the woods, particularly in the ‘Landmarks of Riches’ Treasure’ quest.

If players want an excuse to go beyond the town, this quest gives it to them as they go on the trail for treasure maps. It’ll lead them to all sorts of oddities, like the tiny church east of Lakay, a hobbit-like hill house in Grizzlies East, and a sundial on top of Mount Shann. Aside from a shot at getting some gold, it’ll give players a tour of RDR2 ’s nicest sights.

2 Assassin’s Creed Origins

See Ancient Egypt's Legendary Icons Before They Became Ancient

Practically any Assassin’s Creed game is good for checking out classic landmarks in any historical location. The Ezio Trilogy ( Assassin’s Creed 2-Brotherhood ) offers an in-depth look at the sights and sounds of Renaissance Italy. Assassin’s Creed Valhalla recreates Dark Ages England, and Assassin’s Creed Odyssey brings the Athenian Ruins back to life.

That said, as nice as a pristine recreation of the Acropolis is, it can’t beat the sights of Ancient Egypt in Assassin’s Creed Origins . The sight of the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx in their prime, paint, gold capstone, and all, are stunning enough alone. It also has plenty of sights for players who want something different, like Krokodilopolis, Nitria, the Library of Alexandria, and Memphis.

1 Elden Ring

Fantasy Sights That Are Equally Beautiful as They Are Dangerous

Fromsoft’s Soulsborne games offer wide worlds with plenty to see in them, though few would call them ‘picturesque’ in the traditional sense. Even the nicest sights have something twisted or eerie about them. Elden Ring is different as its locations manage to be stunningly beautiful while still being surreal.

For example, the Underground sounds like it would be a dingy series of caves, but instead looks like a broad series of ornate ruins under a starry sky. Liurnia of the Lakes comes straight out of a Gothic novel with its mists, castles, and rocky outcrops. Meanwhile, the dark turquoise skies of Limgrave contrast nicely with the golden trees. If players can handle the dangers, it would be worth going off the beaten track in Elden Ring .

item.title: Mario Kart Toys Coming Back to McDonald's, But There's a Catch
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • McDonald's and Nintendo are partnering for Mario Kart toys in Australia, previously featured in the US.
  • Fans express excitement for plastic toys vs. cardboard and anticipate future collabs for upcoming Mario games.
  • Collaborations between Mario and McDonald's aren't new, future giveaways and tie-ins likely.

McDonald's and Nintendo are partnering up again, with Mario Kart toys arriving in stores, but there's a catch. These Mario Kart toys will be made available in McDonald's restaurants exclusively in Australia, and fans may notice that the teaser looks familiar.

Nintendo and McDonald's have been partnering for years, bringing toys, events, and giveaways to McDonald's stores. These events are usually a big deal for collectors and fans, with supplies of some giveaways generating tons of demand, like the McDonald's Pokemon Trading Card Game giveaways.

McDonald's is bringing back Mario Kart Happy Meal toys in Australia starting on September 5. The company has released one teaser thus far, showing Mario driving his Kart, seen from behind. Judging from the preview, this appears to be the same Mario Kart toy that was given away in 2022 in the United States. Presumably, the remainder of the toy line will also be on the list for McDonald's Australia giveaways starting soon. In the US collab, eight karts were given away in total, including Mario, Luigi, Donkey Kong, Peach, Toad, Toadette, Yoshi, and Bowser.

No New Mario McDonald's Toys For Now

While it might be disappointing to learn that these don't appear to be a brand new toy line, Mario and McDonald's have had plenty of collabs in recent history. McDonald's, Mario , and Universal teamed up to release a bunch of toys based on The Super Mario Bros Movie , and in Japan, a set of Mario toys based on the Universal Studios' Super Nintendo Land. Similar to Australia just now getting the US' collab, the west may get these toys at a later date, once Super Nintendo World area opens in Universal Orlando. That's currently slated to happen in 2025.

It's also possible that more Mario toys could be in the works to help promote game releases. Mario and Luigi: Brothership releases later in 2024, which could potentially lead to a tie-in. However, there haven't been any major leaks in that regard as of yet. Even if the game doesn't have a McDonald's tie-in, though, Nintendo seems to always have new Mario titles in development, so it's likely just a matter of time until it happens again.

For now, fans in Australia seem to be very excited about this Happy Meals toy collab. Several expressed how excited they were to have plastic toys given away instead of the cardboard that's been used in recent times. Gamers in the area should plan on getting to McDonald's soon after the new Happy Meals arrive, as the stock may not last long.

item.title: A Lot of Diablo 4 Fans Have the Same Pet Peeve About the Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Diablo 4 players dislike traversal, often having to dismount to interact, disrupting gameplay flow.
  • The game boasts a variety of mounts for immersion, but players find traversal frustrating.
  • Blizzard frequently updates Diablo 4 to improve player experience, meaning traversal changes could come in the future.

Diablo 4 players have said they don't like the traversal mechanic, expressing how inconvenient they find it. Diablo 4 frequently receives updates that add new features, seeking to improve the experience for players on their journeys through Sanctuary. But sometimes these changes don't always get the reception expected from the community.

Diablo 4 has an impressive number of mounts that can be obtained and customized, offering an extra degree of immersion. The game has specific mounts for each class and mounts that all characters can use, helping them to traverse the Sanctuary, and explore higher or deeper layer environments. While mounts provide players with a more dynamic way of venturing through Sanctuary, there is one point related to them that is leaving players dissatisfied.

This point is the traversal mechanic, which Reddit user xkitox said they don't like. Revealing that it's a pet peeve they have with Diablo 4 , they say they're not a fan of this feature, explaining that it “kills their momentum” because most of the time they have to dismount from their mount. To exemplify their frustration with traversal, the player shares a screenshot of the Diablo 4 map that shows eight arrows relatively close together which the player must dismount every time they want to interact with the objects found.

Traversal Frustrates Diablo 4 Players

Because of the traversal mechanic, Diablo 4 players with a mount must dismount to interact with an arrow on the map, indicating things like a door, rope, or ladder, and then mount again. In the comments section, other players said they had the same frustration, with one Redditor saying they would “avoid this kind of area if they had the chance,” in response to the image shared by the OP. Another player said they sometimes find the number of doors in dungeons "a bit much sometimes," and a third Redditor joked that “the biggest challenge for a level 100 Sorcerer in a Nightmare Dungeon is all the doors that need to be opened.”

This isn't the first time players have shared a frustration related to the game's mounts. The community has previously expressed dissatisfaction with the constant need to dismount frequently, with Blizzard adding the ability for Diablo 4 players to charge through barricades in one of the game's updates. With Blizzard about to open the test server again in the next few days, players wait to find out if the devs will introduce any change that will improve their experience with the traversal mechanic.

item.title: Helpful New Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom Feature Revealed
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Normal and Hero Modes will be available from the start of Echoes of Wisdom.
  • Hero Mode doubles player damage and removes hearts from the wild.
  • Hero Mode will also disable certain accessory effects during play.

Fans have noticed that The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom will feature the Hero difficulty from the outset. The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is the latest entry in Nintendo’s long-running franchise and gives players the chance to play as Princess Zelda as she adventures through the Kingdom of Hyrule.

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom was announced during the June 2024 Nintendo Direct and is set to release on the Nintendo Switch on September 26. Despite the relatively short build-up time between announcing the game and its release, players have been clamoring for any information about the next entry in the long-running franchise. Fans have dissected the Japanese box art of Echoes of Wisdom looking for clues as to what to expect from the latest adventure. Thanks to Nintendo’s recent demo of the game at PAX West, it seems another feature has been discovered.

As posted by Nintendeal, it appears that Echoes of Wisdom will allow players to choose from Normal or Hero difficulty modes from the outset. The harder Hero mode is designed to challenge players as Zelda will take 2x damage from any hit and hearts that replenish health won’t drop in the wild. This means players have to rely on avoiding as many enemy attacks as possible, or by finding other means of restoring Zelda’s health. The image that accompanies Nintendeal’s post also confirms that Hero mode will deactivate some of the effects of Zelda’s accessories and equipment during the playthrough.

Echoes of Wisdom Has Hero Mode Unlocked From the Start

  • Normal and Hero Modes appear to be available from the start
  • Hero Mode doubles damage to players and removes health hearts
  • Disables abilities and bonuses from certain accessories

This change marks a departure from previous Zelda games, where players could unlock the tougher New Game Plus mode once the main campaign had been completed. Once players finished Breath of the Wild , they were given access to Master Mode. Upon starting this option, the gamer’s progress is reset and tougher enemies such as the White Lynel are set loose in the opening plateau.

News of Hero Mode being unlocked from the get-go is just the latest information that fans are excited about. It was recently confirmed that Echoes of Wisdom will have Amiibo support and players will soon be able to get their hands on some older figures. Nintendo will reprint both Zelda from Wind Waker Amiibo and Link from Link’s Awakening Amiibo when the game is released on September 26. When scanned into Echoes of Wisdom , these figures will give gamers access to new outfits and items throughout Zelda’s headline adventure.
